page.title: 02Danescourt Housing Estate.
page.content: Before Danescourt Estate was built, the area was farmland. It has been developed over the last 10 years and building is still going on. At the present time there must be over 1000 houses, most of which are detached. Our families moved here because we wanted bigger and newer houses. To get to work most people use cars buses or trains (which go from Radyr station). There is a primary school withing walking distance and other schools nearby. At the centre of the estate is the church, St. John the Baptist, and a pub, Radyr Court, which used to be a farmhouse. There used to be 5 shops but only a newsagents and a grocers remain. There is a large field provided, to play in, but no parks. At weekends we go to town on a bus or on our bikes. There is a regular bus service every half hour.
